prompt.prompt:

 2, 3, 5, 8, 12, 20

 The greatest amount of sodium in a fast food item in this dataset is ____ mg.

![](./sodium.png)

![](./sodium.png) 

 - 

 25% of the values in this dataset are between 2.9 mg and ____ mg of sodium.

<!-- - -->

![](./sodium.png) 

 - 

 50% of the values in this dataset are between 1140 mg and ____ mg of sodium.  

<!-- - -->

Choose the box plot (below) that accurately represents this 5-number summary: 

 - 

 <b>Min: 1     <b>Q1: 3     <b>Median: 5.5     <b>Q3: 8     <b>Max: 10 

<!-- - -->

The box plot (below) shows the distribution of weeks to adoption for 32 animals in the shelter. 

 ![](./weeks.png) 

 - 

 Select all of the statements below that are True.

<!-- - -->
distractors: Animals that are adopted in under two weeks are outliers.

answer: Most of the animals were adopted in 7 weeks or less.
About 50% of the animals were adopted in 4 weeks or less.
75% of the animals were adopted in 2.5 weeks or more.
If there are 32 animals in the shelter, then 8 animals spent at least 7 weeks at the shelter before adoption.
